_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Ice Cream and Frozen Dessert Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PUBLIX SUPER MARKETS, INC.- DACULA
DISTRIBUTION AND MANUFACTURING FACILITY
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN


1. Corporate Prevention  and Emergency Response Approach

The Publix Super Markets, Inc. (Publix) Dacula Distribution and Manufacturing Facility are located at 445 Hurricane Trail, Dacula, Gwinnett County, Georgia.  Publix requires each facility to develop and maintain accident prevention programs and an emergency response plan appropriate to the site.  Each site is also responsible for regulatory compliance issues that apply to the site.  Publix 's corporate and division environmental and safety personnel provide assistance in training for site employees and in budgeting and procurement of safety and training services.

2. Description of Stationary Source

The Dacula Distribution and Manufacturing Facilities are located on the north side of State Road 316 just east of the boundary between Lawerenceville and Dacula Georgia.   At the time of this submittal, a new warehouse was under construction.The new warehouse will consist of areas for dry, frozen, and cooler storage of non-perishable and perishable items for distribution to the Publix Super Markets.  The manufacturing facility produces milk, ice cream, and other dairy products which are  stored in the perishable warehouse until they are shipped.

When the new warehouse is completed in late 2004, the Dacula Facility will have two ammonia refrigeration systems which exceed the 10,000 lb. RMP threshold quantity.  The manufacturing facility?s equipment is located in the perishable warehouse and in the compressor room.  The control pressure receiver (CPR) or storage vessel is located inside this room.  The CPR in this process is the largest capacity vessel onsite and is capable of holding approximately 43,058 lbs. of ammonia.  In the new warehouse, the largest vessel will hold 30,000 lbs. of ammonia.  The new refrigeration system was included in this submittal as allowed by the use of predictive filing.


3. Prevention Pr

ogram

This Dacula Facility exceeds the ammonia threshold quantity for the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard, 1910.119, and  the processes are therefore subject to the PSM requirements.  For RMP compliance purposes, this places the refrigeration processes in the Program 3 level.  The Dacula Facility will use its PSM program as the required Program 3 Prevention Program.  Also, in 2001 Publix appointed an individual dedicated solely to the position of PSM Coordinator for the PSM programs at each of their facilities.

The Dacula Facility has a program in place to comply with the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard, 29 CFR 1910.119.  The PSM Program for the manufacturing facility was established in 1995 and was audited in December 1997, Ocotber 2000,and June 2003.  It includes a preventative maintenance plan which requires all ammonia refrigeration equipment to be periodically inspected and serviced.  This will ensure that the equipment remains in good operating condition and will minimize the probability of accidents due to faulty equipment.  

In developing the PSM Program, the Dacula Facility also developed written operating procedures for the refrigeration process.  These procedures cover all phases of operation and include information on safety devices.  These procedures are used to train all operators and mechanics who work on the ammonia refrigeration processes to ensure consistency of operation and minimize human error. These measures ensure that all refrigeration operators and mechanics are properly trained.  Existing safe work practices such as Lockout/Tagout and Hot Work Permit, were reviewed and updated to ensure that all non-routine work can be performed safely.

Other components of the prevention program include collection and periodic review of all equipment information, including Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs).  The staff ensures that if equipment design deficiencies are identified that they are corrected.  These actions will e

nsure that the equipment meets all refrigeration industry standards and that accurate equipment information will be available when needed.

To ensure that the  Dacula Facility's refrigeration staff has the skills necessary to identify unsafe conditions, the training program includes Process Hazards Analyses, Operating Procedures, Maintenance Procedures, Emergency Response, and Safe Work Practices.  Additional PSM procedures, including Management of Change, Pre-Startup Safety Review, Compliance Audits, and Incident Investigation also  ensure the continued safe operation and prompt correction of deficiencies.   The Ammonia Refrigeration Staff, with the assistance of a consultant, performed a PHA of the process in 1995, 1999, and 2004.    The PHA of the new process will be performed in June 2004 prior to start up, which is expected to be at the end of 2004.  The new warehouse PSM Program mirrors the program in place at the manufacturing facility. The PSM Program receives full support of plant management and involvement of employees at all levels.  

4. Accident History

The Dacula Facility has had no accidental releases of ammonia that have resulted in offsite consequences in the past five years.

5. Emergency Response Program

The Dacula Facility has written Emergency Procedures in place.  The program complies with 29 CFR 1910.38.  The site also has some internal emergency response capability and has developed a program to comply with paragraph (q) of 29 CFR 1910.120.  The current plan has been coordinated with the Gwinnett County Fire and Emergency Services.  Notification is made locally by dialing 911or contacting the State Notification point at 1-800-241-4113.
